title: Gilberto Celestino
text:
Gilberto Celestino (born February 13, 1999) is a Dominican professional <a href="baseball">baseball</a> <a href="outfielder">outfielder</a> for the <a href="Minnesota%20Twins">Minnesota Twins</a> of <a href="Major%20League%20Baseball">Major League Baseball</a> (MLB).
Career.
Houston Astros.
Celestino signed with the <a href="Houston%20Astros">Houston Astros</a> as an international free agent on July 2, 2015, for a $2.25 million <a href="signing%20bonus">signing bonus</a>. He split the 2016 season between the <a href="DSL%20Astros">DSL Astros</a> and the <a href="GCL%20Astros">GCL Astros</a>, hitting a combined .257/.365/.393/.758 with 2 home runs and 19 RBI. He spent the 2017 season with the <a href="Greeneville%20Astros">Greeneville Astros</a>, hitting .268/.331/.379/.709 with 4 home runs and 24 RBI. 
Minnesota Twins.
On July 27, 2018, Celestino and <a href="Jorge%20Alcal%C3%A1">Jorge Alcalá</a> were traded to the <a href="Minnesota%20Twins">Minnesota Twins</a> in exchange for <a href="Ryan%20Pressly">Ryan Pressly</a>. Celestino split the 2018 season between the <a href="Tri-City%20ValleyCats">Tri-City ValleyCats</a>, <a href="Corpus%20Christi%20Hooks">Corpus Christi Hooks</a>, and the <a href="Elizabethton%20Twins">Elizabethton Twins</a>, hitting a combined .287/.341/.406/.747 with 5 home runs and 34 RBI.
In 2019, Celestino split the season between the <a href="Cedar%20Rapids%20Kernels">Cedar Rapids Kernels</a> and the <a href="Fort%20Myers%20Miracle">Fort Myers Miracle</a>, hitting a combined .277/.349/.410/.759 with 10 home runs and 54 RBI. Celestino played for the <a href="Dominican%20Republic%20national%20baseball%20team">Dominican Republic national baseball team</a> at the <a href="2019%20WBSC%20Premier12">2019 WBSC Premier12</a>. On November 20, 2019, Celestino was added to the Twins <a href="Major%20League%20Baseball%20rosters">40-man roster</a>. Celestino did not play in a game in 2020 due to the cancellation of the minor league season because of the <a href="COVID-19%20pandemic">COVID-19 pandemic</a>.
On June 2, 2021, Celestino was promoted to the major leagues for the first time. He made his MLB debut that day as the starting center fielder against the <a href="Baltimore%20Orioles">Baltimore Orioles</a>. In the game, he went 0-for-2 before being subbed out for <a href="Miguel%20San%C3%B3">Miguel Sanó</a>. On June 9, Celestino notched his first career hit, a single off of <a href="New%20York%20Yankees">New York Yankees</a> reliever <a href="Brooks%20Kriske">Brooks Kriske</a>.
